Class Dictionary

  • java.lang.Object
    • Dictionary
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>

    public class Dictionary
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dictionary(java.lang.String fileName, boolean sort)
      Constructs a dictionary from the specified text file that contains one word per line and, if necessary, sorts it.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
      Provides a java.util.Iterator that iterates over the Dictionary in order, a word at a time, from beginning to end.
      boolean lookUp(java.lang.String word)
      Looks up the specified word in the Dictionary using a Binary Search algorithm that you write (Do not use any search methods from the Java Standard Library).
      void write(java.lang.String fileName)
      Writes the Dictionary to a text file using the java.io.PrintStream class to the specified name in ascending order and with a newline character between each word.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dictionary

        public Dictionary(java.lang.String fileName,
          boolean sort)
           throws DictionaryException
        Constructs a dictionary from the specified text file that contains one word per line and, if necessary, sorts it. Remember, you must implement your own Bubble, Insertion, or Selection sort algorithm and may not use any Java Standard Library sort methods.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file to read the words from (one word per line).
        sort - Indicates if the words needs sorting, true if the input file needs sorting, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        DictionaryException - when, for any reason, the Dictionary could not be created.

    • Method Detail

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> iterator()
        Provides a java.util.Iterator that iterates over the Dictionary in order, a word at a time, from beginning to end.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        A java.util.Iterator reference that iterates over the Dictionary a word at a time.

      • lookUp

        public boolean lookUp(java.lang.String word)
        Looks up the specified word in the Dictionary using a Binary Search algorithm that you write (Do not use any search methods from the Java Standard Library).
        Returns:
        true if the word is in the Dictionary, otherwise false.

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String fileName)
           throws DictionaryException
        Writes the Dictionary to a text file using the java.io.PrintStream class to the specified name in ascending order and with a newline character between each word.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file to write to.
        Throws:
        DictionaryException - when, for any reason, the dicitonary could not be written.
